article_title: Bob Woodward: History Books Will Blame Obama for Shutdown's Effects
article_body: Bob Woodward: “[Obama] said he will not negotiate on the debt ceiling. A reasonable position. ‘I will not be blackmailed,’ he said. But he should be talking. They should be meeting, discussing this, because as I think Steve Ratner showed earlier, the American economy is at stake and the president, if there is a downturn or a collapse or whatever could happen here, that’s bad, it’s going to be on his head. The history books are going to say, we had an economic calamity in the Presidency of Barack Obama. Speaker Boehner, indeed, is playing a role on this. Go back to the Great Depression in the 1930s. I’ll bet no one can name who was the Speaker of the House at the time. Henry Thomas Rainey. He’s not in the history book; it’s on the president’s head. He’s got to lead. He’s got to talk. And the absence of discussion here, I think, is baffling element.”
comment_texts:
This man does not really care if the economy explodes tomorrow. He lives for the here
and now. Also, because he and his wife hate this country, why try to negotiate with
Congress? He prefers to play golf and drink beer. I hope the low info voters are
finally paying attention: Obama does not feel your PAIN!! His life's too good to bother
about you!!!
